name: Flunitrazepam (lower-dose Hypnodorm)
summary: A potent benzodiazepine hypnotic used at lower doses for insomnia in certain countries.
description: Flunitrazepam is a long-acting benzodiazepine with strong hypnotic, sedative, anxiolytic, and muscle relaxant effects. In some countries, such as Australia, lower-dose formulations (Hypnodorm) are prescribed for severe insomnia when other treatments have failed. Due to its potency, long half-life, and high risk for misuse, it is subject to strict regulation and is not approved in the United States.

monitoring_required: Signs of misuse, dependence, and tolerance

sections.text: Binds to the benzodiazepine site on GABA-A receptors, enhancing the effects of GABA and promoting increased chloride ion influx into neurons, resulting in CNS depression.

adult.insomnia: 0.5–1 mg orally at bedtime; maximum 2 mg/day

sections.geriatric: Start at the lowest possible dose (0.5 mg) to reduce fall and confusion risk
sections.hepatic_impairment: Use with caution; lower doses recommended
sections.renal_impairment: No adjustment, but use with caution

sections.text: Onset: 30–60 minutes; Duration: 6–12 hours (may extend to 24 hours in sensitive patients).

other: High risk of misuse and diversion
Avoid combining with alcohol or opioids

sections.pregnancy: Category D – avoid unless absolutely necessary
sections.lactation: Excreted in breast milk; not recommended
sections.geriatrics: Increased sensitivity; start at lowest dose

sections.text: Gradually taper over weeks to avoid withdrawal symptoms, which may include rebound insomnia, anxiety, and seizures.

items: Lower-dose Hypnodorm formulations aim to reduce next-day impairment while maintaining hypnotic efficacy
Due to long half-life, may accumulate with nightly use
